Subset samples using the BIOM's metadata or taxonomy.

Source: R/subset.r
subset.Rd

Subset samples using the BIOM's metadata or taxonomy.

# S3 method for BIOM
subset(
  x,
  expr,
  env = parent.frame(),
  drop.na = TRUE,
  refactor = TRUE,
  fast = FALSE
)

Arguments

x

A BIOM object, as returned from read.biom.
expr

Logical expression to run on the metadata or taxonomy (not both) to identify samples or taxa to retain.
env

The environment to search for variables used in expr. (Default: parent.frame())
drop.na

When expr is e.g. Age > 30, should !is.na(Age) be automatically applied too?
refactor

When expr is e.g. `Body Site` %in% c("Stool", "Saliva"), should `Body Site` be redefined as factor(`Body Site`, levels=c('Stool', 'Saliva'))? Applies to non-numeric metadata only.
fast

Should subsetting the phylogenetic tree and sequences be skipped? These slow steps are often not necessary. (Default: FALSE)

Value

A BIOM object.

See also

select

Examples

    library(rbiom)
    
    ex1 <- subset(hmp50, Age > 30)
    ex2 <- subset(hmp50, Phylum %in% c("Firmicutes", "Actinobacteria"))
    ex3 <- subset(hmp50, `Body Site` %in% c("Saliva", "Stool"))
    ex4 <- subset(hmp50, a == b, list(a = as.name("Body Site"), b ="Saliva"))
    ex5 <- subset(hmp50, Age < 25 & BMI > 22)
